title: REST API - File System Mobile App
desc: Hi, I'm looking for someone to develop an iOS app that that can perform the below tasks.1) Provide a user login prompt - User details must be sent to a REST service to be authenticated and receive a unique access code.2) Display a file tree - The app must be able to fetch a json array (of file system data) from a rest service and render the results as a navigable file system.3) Open files - If a user clicks on a file in the file system, the app must request the binary file from the REST service and open it on the device.4) Upload Files - If a user opens a separate app or file and chooses to (sendto/shareto/openwith) this app, the app must prompt the user with the file system. Once the user selects a folder location the app must post the binary file and the selected location to the REST service.The REST service has already been developed but the structure of the data it returns or requests can be modified if the developer of the app requires it. Currently all data returned form the REST service is JSON.

title: Build a GPS tracking platform website and 2 apps for trackers -- 2
desc: We are looking for a company who have built similar GPS tracking platforms to build one for us- you MUST have a proven track record in it and show me samples- NO other samples of other websites needed. Please be specific with examplesBEST WAY IS TO HAVE A SOLUTION BUILT THAT YOU CAN CHANGE FOR MESpecification• GPS Track a child/adult/pet• GPS Track a vehicle or luggage• Monitor vehicle speed• Monitor elderly family members - Fall & Movement detection• Live Tracking: Track the location of your tracking devices in your vehicle, people, mobile or asset in real time on our efficient interface.• History: stores full travel history and information data of each tracker for the previous rolling 90 days.• Reports: Customise and create over 15 different detailed travel, usage and telematics reports, and export document files.• Geofencing: This feature allows users to set up custom geographical zones and boundaries around specific areas on the map.• Routes: Create and save previously travelled routes and activate alerts for vehicles that enters or leaves selected routes.• Speed Alerts• Points Of Interest (POI): Markers can be used to log and highlight different addresses, shops or points on the tracking map.• Send Commands: Change settings and modes on supported trackers directly on-line using our integrated 'Command Centre'.• Alerts & Notifications: Create SMS message or email alerts for important events such as speeding, SOS, ignition, movement and much more.• User Interface: Fully customisable user interface including time zone, colour schemes, sounds and icon sizes to name a few.• Admin Management center• Agency Management center• Billing/recurring invoicing system• Android App• IOS AppRequirements:1.	Trackers will be from [url removed, login to view] and [url removed, login to view]2.	Email notifications for alerts3.	The most advanced tracker is [url removed, login to view] so we need to be able to read their inputs and outputs, eg. Door open,4.	The app will be used for people, assets and vehicles so need ability to select which one5.	Support ticket system6.	Real time locations7.	Events list of alarms8.	Low battery indicator9.	User management of each tracker showing details on who has it10.	Tamper alertSee attached document

title: Spanish Speaking Corona SDK Mobile Developer needed
desc: Hi,Please do not respond to this post unless you have at least 5 ratings of 5 and have a strong command of LUA and CORONA SDK. If you do, please send me a list of Apps you've completed with Corona SDK and where I can download them to see.Although this is very much part time work (at first), this job will require a developer willing to be available via Skype each day (if necessary), provide a mobile phone number (for emergencies only), and require a developer that uses a Mac for development and has experiencing in building apps for iOS and Android.The chosen developer will have to learn my framework, my coding style be willing to share insights. Any developers with experience making nice particle effects using the built in particle engine within Corona is not required, but a plus. So that I  know you are human, put the two words got it at the top of your cover letter.The beginning of our work will focus primarily on the new Spanish version of our game. So, this will give you an opportunity to work on an existing game in the market and more specifically, you will have to tell us if we have properly handled the localization for the Spanish language properly!Please respond to this job post with specific text so that I'm not having to review many websites you've developed as well as apps. Please show me only what is necessary to review.Also, please look at my buyer/client profile and say something within your cover letter than indicates you have read it. title: Software base VoiP call termination from Mobile phone and connected to server with interface
desc: We are looking for solution like a traditional GSM or CDMA VoiP gateway. This project will be separated in two parts. One is mobile application and another one is registration server.The Mobile application will register to a server and accept call from that server with IXA or SIP protocol. After that call will terminate to a GSM network. (this part just like a traditional GMS getaway) This mobile application will work on  wifi Internet connectivity and mobile Data internet ,All call will pass with G729 codecThe registration server may be Asterisk or VOIP switch or any other server or customize server. This server will receive call from another VOIP switch server with SIP protocol.Certain number of registered Mobile will be able to assign in a group of gateway. On server have to include option to show balance through USSDall cell phones will act as a port like any normal voip gateway .the application should be connected to interface to manage all ports .security should be high on the server .the project should accept any number of new cellphones added to interface .also any new cell phone should be given a security key to allow it to be added in my server .

title: Help me Overcome Same Origin Policy problem (I think) in Simple Working Mobile App Developed with Cordova, Node.js, Express
desc: Hi.  I am Philip Lam and I have just started learning mobile app development.I am trying to develop a basic mobile app which can get and post data to a server.I have managed to get a very simple mobile app working.Briefly, the mobile app moves some Jsonp and Json around.The back end is an Express Node.js server ([url removed, login to view]).  The data is sent between the front end and the back end by way of jQuery JSON GETs and POSTs.So far, I have successfully gotten the server side to launch and work.  The server also correctly tracks and sends information.  Furthermore, the browser on my PC is also able to detect the server's performance.  All this is working fine.The problem is that when the mobile app is launched into the Android emulation, it does not respond at all to any clicks on the mobile app.  On the other hand, the browser on the Android emulation (when directed to [url removed, login to view]) does show the correct response from the server.  That is, clicking on the Test JSONP button sends the Jsonp message to the console log and clicking on the Test JSON button sends the Json message to the console log.  (BTW, [url removed, login to view] is the loopback IP address for the Android emulation to access the server which is on the same PC as the emulation whereas 3000 is the port where the server is listening.)I strongly suspect that the problem lies with the Same-Policy Origin and if I am correct, I wish to use whatever means to overcome the problem.  From the code, you wills see that I have already tried JSONP and CORS.  Please debug the code and show me the correct code.The code "works" perfectly in that the server is clearly working (since my PC browser and also the Android emulation browser can both "see" and track the server).  The problem is that the mobile app itself does not detect or "see" the server's responses at all.  In fact, clicking on the buttons in the mobile app results in no response at all.There is a limit to the number of words I can type here so I have put all the code into a word document for your reference.Thanks and I look forward to hearing from you.Regards,Philip Lam
